comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Probably the former Mrs. Collins, second wife of Harvard-educated stockbroker William Laimbeer.  They wed in 1909.   But Laimbeer's first wife, the former stage actress Clara Bloodgood (1870-1907), died by suicide (gunshot)--so this could be an older photo of her, instead.

comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content:
LAIMBEER'S WIDOW DRAMATIC ON STAND; Re-enacts How She Threw Arms Around Husband Just Before Train Hit Auto. W. K. VANDERBILT, JR., HEARD Asserts in Mrs. Pell's Suit Against Railroad That View at Crossing Was Unobstructed.
June 16, 1915, Wednesday
Page 8, 2043 words
Mrs. Nathalie Schenck Laimbeer, widow of William S. Laimbeer, the only survivor of the automobile accident on Aug. 3, 1913, in which her husband and S. Osgood Pell were killed by a Long Island train near Long Beach, yesterday described her experiences in the smash-up for the jury that will decide Mrs. Pell's' suit against the railroad company seeking $250,000 for the death of her husband.
